main event: A letter was sent requesting information regarding sighting objects believed to be meteors during the Perseids meteor shower.
interesting points: The sighting occurred during the peak of the Perseids meteor shower, which lasted from 9 to 13 August 1957., The object observed was described as a meteoric form, specifically referred to as a 'bolide' or 'fireball'., Fireballs are described as looking like magnesium flares, persisting until they reach the ground., The report indicated a larger number of meteoroids and fireballs were observed during this period., The observer was advised that fireballs differ from ordinary meteors in visibility and longevity.
witness description: Letter from an unidentified person reporting the sighting.
